instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3462 Macbook Pro A1425 PPBUS_G3H is 12.25V
threads.message: No short on system side ,replace u7000 with 3 different one and still gives only 12.25V ,macbook have green light on charger doesnt turn on ,everything look clean ,R7021 and R7022 measure 10K

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3462 Macbook Pro A1425 PPBUS_G3H is 12.25V
threads.message: I'd hope you mean 10 ohms not kilohms on those two resistors...12.2 means SMC not running. Diode mode pin 2 of R5280 and R5281 to see if either or both lines are being pulled down. I think this is the one with the completely edge bonded SMC, so my best guess is your SMC is dead.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3462 Macbook Pro A1425 PPBUS_G3H is 12.25V
threads.message: replace the smc now ppbus_g3h is 12.52v but missing pm_slp_s4

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3462 Macbook Pro A1425 PPBUS_G3H is 12.25V
threads.message: Hmmm. Any history on this liquid drop damage tech damage etc?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3462 Macbook Pro A1425 PPBUS_G3H is 12.25V
threads.message: SOLVED I just reflow SMC little bit more and now working ok
